name: Crispy Chicken Thighs with Spring Vegetables
source_file: Crispy Chicken Thighs with Spring Vegetables.txt
author: Anna Stockwell
description: The rich and zesty pan sauce is what makes this simple, seasonal supper something you'll want to eat again and again.
ingredients: 8 small bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 3 pounds)
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided
1 pound baby new potatoes, halved if larger than 1/2 inch
2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons vegetable oil, divided
1 tablespoon anchovy paste, or 6 fillets, finely chopped
1/2 cup (1 stick) cold butter, cut into 1-tablespoon pieces, divided
1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley, plus more for serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 450Â°F. Using kitchen shears, remove bones from chicken thighs, keeping skin and flesh intact; discard bones. Season chicken all over with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.

Toss asparagus, potatoes, radishes, 2 tablespoons oil, and remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Transfer everything but the asparagus to a rimmed baking sheet and roast 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, grease another rimmed baking sheet with 1 teaspoon oil. Heat remaining 1 teaspoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Working in batches, sear chicken skin side down until skin is crisp and golden brown, 5-7 minutes. Transfer skin side up to prepared sheet.
After all chicken is seared (reserve fat in skillet), transfer baking sheet to oven and roast until chicken is cooked through, 8-10 minutes.

When you open oven to roast chicken, remove baking sheet with vegetables, arrange asparagus over potatoes and radishes, then continue to roast until asparagus is crisp-tender and potatoes and radishes are well browned and tender, 8-10 minutes more.

Meanwhile, carefully pour off excess fat from reserved skillet, leaving browned bits on the bottom. Add garlic, anchovy paste, and 1 tablespoon butter to skillet and cook over medium heat until garlic is softened and fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add wine, scraping up browned bits with a spatula, and continue to cook, stirring, until reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat and stir in lemon juice.
Add remaining butter one piece at a time, swirling and stirring after each addition to fully emulsify sauce. Stir in 1 tablespoon parsley.
Transfer chicken and vegetables to a platter, then pour sauce over. Top with more parsley before serving.
notes: You can keep the bones in your chicken thighs if you prefer - roast in oven 12-14 minutes instead of 8-10.
